tags: do i make this into a fic?
body:
College!Peter (Peter x Reader)

Peter Parker stumbling in late to one of his first university classes at MIT. As he shuffles in he notices that almost all the seats are full except for one near the centre. As he makes his way he is tripping and shuffling past other people, apologizing as he goes. As he finally sits down and begins to unpack his bag he realizes he left his notebook and text book in his dorm room. He slides down, and makes an almost inaudible sigh. You look over at the poor guy next to you.

“Are you okay?” You whisper.

“Yeah, I uhm left my class stuff in my room”

“I have an extra pen, and some scrap paper if you need some and you can share my textbook today if you want?”

“That would be great,” he smiled.

As the class went on you couldn’t help but notice how cute this guy was. Also how smart he was, he was finishing equations and answering questions before the prof had even explained it. When class was over and you began packing up he was standing already collected holding your pen out for you.

“Peter Parker,” he said quickly.

“What?”

“My name, it’s Peter Parker,” he quickly dropped his eyes to the floor and ran his fingers through his hair.

“(Y/N) (Y/L/N),” you smiled offering a hand to shake.

He looked up and shook your hand.

“Nice to meet you (Y/N),” he smiled.

summary: It’s Hard When You’re Young (Peter Parker x Reader Series)
title: It’s Hard When You’re Young (Peter Parker x Reader Series)
body:
Chapter Summary: Peter lost and so did you

Author’s Note: At the beginning of this fic, Peter and the Reader have about a five year age difference. That said, nothing creepy will come out of it. This age difference will become important later on in the story. Be rest assured, until everyone is legal, nothing is going to happen.

Parts 1-20: Masterlist

Peter Parker - 17/18 years old
Reader - 13 years old

Chapter 21: The Battle Ends

Peter was so close. He had slipped it off of his wrist and he was about to fall backwards when he felt that it was finally off of his hand when Thanos grabbed hold of the gauntlet just in time, making Peter fall backwards, onto the ground. He was so close. He nearly had it. If it were not for Star-Lord—no, Peter did not have time to think about that because Mantis had been thrown away like she was nothing and he is pretty sure she is not conscious. He leaps to his feet and goes after her, wrapping her in his arms and activating the Iron Spider’s legs to help break their fall.

They land far away from the main fight and Peter can only watch the moment happen before him because the reality that maybe this is not the one outcome out of fourteen million that they win is hitting him so hard that he feels like he cannot breathe.

If he knew that this was going to be the end, he would have spent more time with Aunt May and Ned instead of going out at night, waiting for crime to happen. He would have visited you more at the X-Mansion, learned more about your time there, about your powers. Maybe he could have helped you out more, be it school or otherwise. He would have made more of an effort in school, maybe he would not have quit as many clubs as he did. Maybe he would have told MJ how he felt, maybe even hinted at it.

Peter thinks that he is too young to have so many regrets and he cannot bring himself to believe that this is the end of it all.

He is just about to gather his bearings, force himself to rejoin the fight, to help the adults out (oh my God, he really is just a kid compared to everyone here), when something crashes into the planet and sends everything and everyone flying. The gravitational pull of the planet seems to have been disturbed and Peter works fast to save his unconscious companions. He brings Mantis around with him, swinging around and avoiding debris, until he finds a place to web her to. He does the same for the others, quickly webbing them before the fly into orbit.

He regrets not knowing anyone’s names.

…

Visions falls in a heap next to you and, for a moment, he thinks that the two of you are done for. Both your wounds are fatal and the alien monster has the upper hand. He need only to attack him once more, hit him where it would really hurt. Vision thinks he has just enough power in him to hold him off, he just has to, but Vision is not confident that he will last long. He thinks of a game plan, a way to save not only himself but you, when Captain Rogers appears, seemingly out of nowhere, and tackles the alien down.

“Get out of here!” Captain Rogers orders him before he turns back to his opponent. Vision does not need to be told twice but he finds that he does not have it in him to push himself off the ground. He is in too much pain, too damaged. You are still unconscious next to him, eyes closed and barely breathing. You probably—desperately need medical attention.

Even if Vision could get himself to stand, he cannot bring you along with him if he manages to even walk.

“GO!” Captain Rogers urges when he sees that Vision is still in the same spot. Vision supposes that Captain Rogers has not caught sight of you or else he would have done something to help.

Vision forces himself to move once more, thinking of how to bring you along with him. It is his fault, really, that you are in the situation that you are in now. He thinks that, if you were awake, like all the other heroes, himself included, you would insist that it was your job.

If he makes it out of this fight alive, he makes a note to talk to Wanda about entrusting such a heavy responsibility to thirteen year olds.

Then again, if you were not around to help him, Vision does not think he would have made it this far.

Captain Rogers is able to disarm the alien, forcing the weapon to the ground. They fight hand to hand, moving further away from the weapon and Visions sees this as his chance. Instead of escaping, because honestly there is no way he can take you along with him, he makes a move towards the weapon, forcing himself to ignore the sharp shooting pain all over his body.

The alien pushes Captain Rogers to the ground and it looks like the hero is struggling to get himself free. Vision grabs hold of the weapon and in one swift movement, stabs the alien through his back. He pushes it further in, making sure that the blade is deep, and lifts him off of Captain Rogers before letting him fall to the side. The mere act takes all of Vision’s energy and he falls to his knees.

“I thought I told you to go,” Captain Rogers says as he helps Vision to his feet.

“We don’t trade lives, Captain,” Vision tells him and although he is directing the comment to the hero, he is also talking about you. He jerks his head towards your direction and Captain Rogers swears under his breath.

“Is…is she alive?” He asks and Visions does not know how he would react if he heard otherwise.

“Just barely,” Visions replies. “She really held her own out here.”

Captain Rogers shakes his head, not accepting the complement Vision pays you.

“She’s just a kid.”

And it is true. Vision cannot deny this especially when he sees you bleeding on the ground, very far away from home and everything that is familiar to you.

“I do not think that matters during a war, Captain.”

Captain Rogers’ lips form a tight line and Vision thinks that maybe he should have kept his mouth shut.

“It should.”

…

There really was no way for Peter to jump into the fight Dr. Strange and Mr. Stark had with Thanos, but, by the end of it all, he really wished that he had at least tried. He was so far away, watching over the unconscious Guardians, and he honestly did not have a lot of fight left in him, but goddammit he should have been there.

If he had, maybe Mr. Stark would not have been stabbed.

If he had, maybe Dr. Strange would not have felt like he had no option but to give the Time stone to Thanos.

All the ifs and maybe circled Peter’s mind as he, Mantis, and Drax followed Star-Lord’s lead and made their way to Mr. Stark and Dr. Strange. Thanos is nowhere to be seen and all they can do now is sit on this blasted planet and lick their wounds.

This is not how Peter imagined his first fight as an Avenger to play out.

He wants to go home, he really, truly wants to go home, but he cannot start whining like a child when everyone is helpless and defeated. He thinks how they can make it back to Earth but their original spaceship is bust and he is pretty sure that they cannot just build something out of all the metal bits and pieces scattered around. He wants to ask Mr. Stark what they should do next, what can they do next, but he keeps quiet. He has never seen Mr. Stark look so lost and afraid and, frankly, he needs to tear his eyes away because no one should see their hero look like that.

The entire time he had been in the ship and on this planet, Peter had forced himself not to dwell too much on thoughts of home, friends, and family. He needed to focus on the mission but now that they have failed, he could not help but let his thoughts go straight to those three things.

Peter cannot believe how much he misses Aunt May’s (attempt at) cooking, Ned’s constant movie references and eagerness to be the “guy in the chair,” and your complaints about your schoolmates and lessons. He does not want to think that there is no going back from this planet but after everything that is happened, Peter cannot find it in himself to be hopeful.

This is so bad. This is the worst thing that ever could have happened.

And it could have been prevented.

If only he had been stronger.

Peter has his head in his hands because he does not want his companions to see the look of utter defeat and despair on his face. Never mind the fact that they probably look the same way. He just needs to be alone with his thoughts right now. He tries to really focus on his memories, find comfort in dancing in the living room with Aunt May, beating Ned at a game of Mario Kart, and seeing juggle things in the air using your powers. He tries to remember the sounds of laughter, cheers of triumph, and whispers of promises.

Forever.

Peter cannot believe that he is breaking his promise to you.

Peter…

Great, now you are haunting him.

Pe…Peter…

He looks up from his hands and turns around to scan his surroundings.

Doctor Strange. Mr. Stark. Mantis. Drax. New Blue Robot Lady. Star-Lord.

I…I…Peter…

“That’s not a memory,” Peter mumbles to himself and maybe his companions heard him but he cannot bring himself to meet their gaze because he can hear your voice and you are nowhere on this planet.

Lo…ou…Peter…

Peter feels his heart fall to his stomach and he settles back down on his seat. He feels sick and not in the way that he has felt the entire time in space.

“You okay, kid?” Mr. Stark asks and Peter looks at the man and suddenly he cannot stay strong anymore.

“I lost,” Peter whispers and he cannot believe how hard it is to get the words out.

“I know,” Mr. Stark says and it sounds like an apology. “We all did.”

Peter shakes his head but cannot bring himself to explain that yes, they lost the fight, but it feels like he has lost something more.

…

You do not think you are dead because not only do you have a splitting headache (damn, what did you do before you passed out?), your mind is also filled with numerous thoughts that belong to you and those around. You feel nothing but pain and you think that maybe you should just stay wherever you are lest you injure yourself further. The voices in your head grow stronger, some of them shouts of victory and adrenaline while others are that off concern and exhaustion.

You feel a warmth on your belly and you feel Wanda’s presence. You feel the pain in your side ebb away and you suddenly remember the tricks she has taught you during your time on the jet. You will your power to go to your wound and you help Wanda stitch you back together.

You are clumsy and you feel yourself let out gasps of pain but Wanda helps and before you know it, you feel yourself opening your eyes.

Everything is blurry and your throat feels dry. You are not sure if you are just thirsty or maybe you ate some dirt when you fell down. You do not want to think too much about it. You might just throw up.

The voices in your head seem far off now and you focus your attention to those closest to you.

“Is she going to be okay?” You hear Captain America ask and you do not need to read his mind to know that he is very tired.

“She will be,” Wanda says and you feel like you could sleep for a hundred years. Maybe when you wake up, you could be the next Captain America.

“You did good, kid,” Captain America says when you push yourself off the ground, keeping your cries muffled. “You can stand down now.”

“I think I’ll do that,” you say with much effort and you try to relax against whatever it is that is behind you when you hear Vision let out a cry out pain. Wanda is immediately by his side and you feel a sense of dread wash over you, numbing you to your wounds.

“Are you okay?” Wanda asks and Vision lets out another sound of pain. “What…What is it?”

“He’s here,” Vision replies, eyes wide and scanning the area.

You do not need to ask who it is. The wind patterns change and you look around the forest, trying to find out where Thanos is going to pop out from. Your eyes land on the space behind Dr. Banner and you watch as a blue portal appears behind him. Wanda is prepared to fight, red energy forming at her fingertips, and you force yourself to your feet, looking for things to use to attack.

Now is not the time to stand down.

Not while this monster is still around.

“Eyes up,” Captain America says as he begins to make his way towards Thanos, “Stay sharp.”

You watch from your place as Thanos easily defeats the Avengers, trapping Dr. Banner in stone, tossing Captain America aside, knocking out the Black Panther, and destroying the Falcon’s wings. You immediately lose concentration and are scared. These are Earth’s Mightiest Heroes and Thanos is going through them like they are nothing. You look to Wanda and Vision and see that although you are near them, you are not close enough to protect or be protected.

You see that the other Avengers are coming closer and you try to buy them some time by using all that is left in you to create a force field to keep Thanos from coming any closer. He nearly stops in his tracks, sensing the invisible barrier, and you almost feel victories when looks eyes with you. You try to push him back, you really do, but it is a futile attempt. He moves his hand in a motion that causes you to fly the opposite direction and land painfully on the ground. You try to get up but you feel the roots of the trees wrap around your arms, legs, and neck, and you know that you are defeated.

All you can do is listen to the grunts of pain from the Avengers as well as the cries from Wanda and Vision.

You close your eyes, waiting for the end to come.

Part 22: Powerless

The mere act takes all of Vision’s energy and he falls to his knees.

“I thought I told you to go,” Captain Rogers says as he helps Vision to his feet.

“We don’t trade lives, Captain,” Vision tells him and although he is directing the comment to the hero, he is also talking about you. He jerks his head towards your direction and Captain Rogers swears under his breath.

“Is…is she alive?” He asks and Visions does not know how he would react if he heard otherwise.

“Just barely,” Visions replies. “She really held her own out here.”

Captain Rogers shakes his head, not accepting the complement Vision pays you.

“She’s just a kid.”

And it is true. Vision cannot deny this especially when he sees you bleeding on the ground, very far away from home and everything that is familiar to you.

“I do not think that matters during a war, Captain.”

Captain Rogers’ lips form a tight line and Vision thinks that maybe he should have kept his mouth shut.

“It should.”

…

There really was no way for Peter to jump into the fight Dr. Strange and Mr. Stark had with Thanos, but, by the end of it all, he really wished that he had at least tried. He was so far away, watching over the unconscious Guardians, and he honestly did not have a lot of fight left in him, but goddammit he should have been there.

If he had, maybe Mr. Stark would not have been stabbed.

If he had, maybe Dr. Strange would not have felt like he had no option but to give the Time stone to Thanos.

All the ifs and maybe circled Peter’s mind as he, Mantis, and Drax followed Star-Lord’s lead and made their way to Mr. Stark and Dr. Strange. Thanos is nowhere to be seen and all they can do now is sit on this blasted planet and lick their wounds.

This is not how Peter imagined his first fight as an Avenger to play out.

He wants to go home, he really, truly wants to go home, but he cannot start whining like a child when everyone is helpless and defeated. He thinks how they can make it back to Earth but their original spaceship is bust and he is pretty sure that they cannot just build something out of all the metal bits and pieces scattered around. He wants to ask Mr. Stark what they should do next, what can they do next, but he keeps quiet. He has never seen Mr. Stark look so lost and afraid and, frankly, he needs to tear his eyes away because no one should see their hero look like that.

The entire time he had been in the ship and on this planet, Peter had forced himself not to dwell too much on thoughts of home, friends, and family. He needed to focus on the mission but now that they have failed, he could not help but let his thoughts go straight to those three things.

Peter cannot believe how much he misses Aunt May’s (attempt at) cooking, Ned’s constant movie references and eagerness to be the “guy in the chair,” and your complaints about your schoolmates and lessons. He does not want to think that there is no going back from this planet but after everything that is happened, Peter cannot find it in himself to be hopeful.

This is so bad. This is the worst thing that ever could have happened.

And it could have been prevented.

If only he had been stronger.

Peter has his head in his hands because he does not want his companions to see the look of utter defeat and despair on his face. Never mind the fact that they probably look the same way. He just needs to be alone with his thoughts right now. He tries to really focus on his memories, find comfort in dancing in the living room with Aunt May, beating Ned at a game of Mario Kart, and seeing juggle things in the air using your powers. He tries to remember the sounds of laughter, cheers of triumph, and whispers of promises.

Forever.

Peter cannot believe that he is breaking his promise to you.

Peter…

Great, now you are haunting him.

Pe…Peter…

He looks up from his hands and turns around to scan his surroundings.

Doctor Strange. Mr. Stark. Mantis. Drax. New Blue Robot Lady. Star-Lord.

I…I…Peter…

“That’s not a memory,” Peter mumbles to himself and maybe his companions heard him but he cannot bring himself to meet their gaze because he can hear your voice and you are nowhere on this planet.

Lo…ou…Peter…

Peter feels his heart fall to his stomach and he settles back down on his seat. He feels sick and not in the way that he has felt the entire time in space.

“You okay, kid?” Mr. Stark asks and Peter looks at the man and suddenly he cannot stay strong anymore.

“I lost,” Peter whispers and he cannot believe how hard it is to get the words out.

“I know,” Mr. Stark says and it sounds like an apology. “We all did.”

Peter shakes his head but cannot bring himself to explain that yes, they lost the fight, but it feels like he has lost something more.

…

You do not think you are dead because not only do you have a splitting headache (damn, what did you do before you passed out?), your mind is also filled with numerous thoughts that belong to you and those around. You feel nothing but pain and you think that maybe you should just stay wherever you are lest you injure yourself further. The voices in your head grow stronger, some of them shouts of victory and adrenaline while others are that off concern and exhaustion.

You feel a warmth on your belly and you feel Wanda’s presence. You feel the pain in your side ebb away and you suddenly remember the tricks she has taught you during your time on the jet. You will your power to go to your wound and you help Wanda stitch you back together.

You are clumsy and you feel yourself let out gasps of pain but Wanda helps and before you know it, you feel yourself opening your eyes.

Everything is blurry and your throat feels dry. You are not sure if you are just thirsty or maybe you ate some dirt when you fell down. You do not want to think too much about it. You might just throw up.

The voices in your head seem far off now and you focus your attention to those closest to you.

“Is she going to be okay?” You hear Captain America ask and you do not need to read his mind to know that he is very tired.

“She will be,” Wanda says and you feel like you could sleep for a hundred years. Maybe when you wake up, you could be the next Captain America.

“You did good, kid,” Captain America says when you push yourself off the ground, keeping your cries muffled. “You can stand down now.”

“I think I’ll do that,” you say with much effort and you try to relax against whatever it is that is behind you when you hear Vision let out a cry out pain. Wanda is immediately by his side and you feel a sense of dread wash over you, numbing you to your wounds.

“Are you okay?” Wanda asks and Vision lets out another sound of pain. “What…What is it?”

“He’s here,” Vision replies, eyes wide and scanning the area.

You do not need to ask who it is. The wind patterns change and you look around the forest, trying to find out where Thanos is going to pop out from. Your eyes land on the space behind Dr. Banner and you watch as a blue portal appears behind him. Wanda is prepared to fight, red energy forming at her fingertips, and you force yourself to your feet, looking for things to use to attack.

Now is not the time to stand down.

Not while this monster is still around.

“Eyes up,” Captain America says as he begins to make his way towards Thanos, “Stay sharp.”

You watch from your place as Thanos easily defeats the Avengers, trapping Dr. Banner in stone, tossing Captain America aside, knocking out the Black Panther, and destroying the Falcon’s wings. You immediately lose concentration and are scared. These are Earth’s Mightiest Heroes and Thanos is going through them like they are nothing. You look to Wanda and Vision and see that although you are near them, you are not close enough to protect or be protected.

You see that the other Avengers are coming closer and you try to buy them some time by using all that is left in you to create a force field to keep Thanos from coming any closer. He nearly stops in his tracks, sensing the invisible barrier, and you almost feel victories when looks eyes with you. You try to push him back, you really do, but it is a futile attempt. He moves his hand in a motion that causes you to fly the opposite direction and land painfully on the ground. You try to get up but you feel the roots of the trees wrap around your arms, legs, and neck, and you know that you are defeated.

All you can do is listen to the grunts of pain from the Avengers as well as the cries from Wanda and Vision.

You close your eyes, waiting for the end to come.

Part 22: Powerless

Doctor Strange. Mr. Stark. Mantis. Drax. New Blue Robot Lady. Star-Lord.

I…I…Peter…

“That’s not a memory,” Peter mumbles to himself and maybe his companions heard him but he cannot bring himself to meet their gaze because he can hear your voice and you are nowhere on this planet.

Lo…ou…Peter…

Peter feels his heart fall to his stomach and he settles back down on his seat. He feels sick and not in the way that he has felt the entire time in space.

“You okay, kid?” Mr. Stark asks and Peter looks at the man and suddenly he cannot stay strong anymore.

“I lost,” Peter whispers and he cannot believe how hard it is to get the words out.

“I know,” Mr. Stark says and it sounds like an apology. “We all did.”

Peter shakes his head but cannot bring himself to explain that yes, they lost the fight, but it feels like he has lost something more.

…

You do not think you are dead because not only do you have a splitting headache (damn, what did you do before you passed out?), your mind is also filled with numerous thoughts that belong to you and those around. You feel nothing but pain and you think that maybe you should just stay wherever you are lest you injure yourself further. The voices in your head grow stronger, some of them shouts of victory and adrenaline while others are that off concern and exhaustion.

You feel a warmth on your belly and you feel Wanda’s presence. You feel the pain in your side ebb away and you suddenly remember the tricks she has taught you during your time on the jet. You will your power to go to your wound and you help Wanda stitch you back together.

You are clumsy and you feel yourself let out gasps of pain but Wanda helps and before you know it, you feel yourself opening your eyes.

Everything is blurry and your throat feels dry. You are not sure if you are just thirsty or maybe you ate some dirt when you fell down. You do not want to think too much about it. You might just throw up.

The voices in your head seem far off now and you focus your attention to those closest to you.

“Is she going to be okay?” You hear Captain America ask and you do not need to read his mind to know that he is very tired.

“She will be,” Wanda says and you feel like you could sleep for a hundred years. Maybe when you wake up, you could be the next Captain America.

“You did good, kid,” Captain America says when you push yourself off the ground, keeping your cries muffled. “You can stand down now.”

“I think I’ll do that,” you say with much effort and you try to relax against whatever it is that is behind you when you hear Vision let out a cry out pain. Wanda is immediately by his side and you feel a sense of dread wash over you, numbing you to your wounds.

“Are you okay?” Wanda asks and Vision lets out another sound of pain. “What…What is it?”

“He’s here,” Vision replies, eyes wide and scanning the area.

You do not need to ask who it is. The wind patterns change and you look around the forest, trying to find out where Thanos is going to pop out from. Your eyes land on the space behind Dr. Banner and you watch as a blue portal appears behind him. Wanda is prepared to fight, red energy forming at her fingertips, and you force yourself to your feet, looking for things to use to attack.

Now is not the time to stand down.

Not while this monster is still around.

“Eyes up,” Captain America says as he begins to make his way towards Thanos, “Stay sharp.”

You watch from your place as Thanos easily defeats the Avengers, trapping Dr. Banner in stone, tossing Captain America aside, knocking out the Black Panther, and destroying the Falcon’s wings. You immediately lose concentration and are scared. These are Earth’s Mightiest Heroes and Thanos is going through them like they are nothing. You look to Wanda and Vision and see that although you are near them, you are not close enough to protect or be protected.

You see that the other Avengers are coming closer and you try to buy them some time by using all that is left in you to create a force field to keep Thanos from coming any closer. He nearly stops in his tracks, sensing the invisible barrier, and you almost feel victories when looks eyes with you. You try to push him back, you really do, but it is a futile attempt. He moves his hand in a motion that causes you to fly the opposite direction and land painfully on the ground. You try to get up but you feel the roots of the trees wrap around your arms, legs, and neck, and you know that you are defeated.

All you can do is listen to the grunts of pain from the Avengers as well as the cries from Wanda and Vision.

You close your eyes, waiting for the end to come.

Part 22: Powerless

trail.content_abstract:
Chapter Summary: Peter lost and so did you

Author’s Note: At the beginning of this fic, Peter and the Reader have about a five year age difference. That said, nothing creepy will come out of it. This age difference will become important later on in the story. Be rest assured, until everyone is legal, nothing is going to happen.

Parts 1-20: Masterlist

Peter Parker - 17/18 years old
Reader - 13 years old

Chapter 21: The Battle Ends

Peter was so close. He had slipped it off of his wrist and he was about to fall backwards when he felt that it was finally off of his hand when Thanos grabbed hold of the gauntlet just in time, making Peter fall backwards, onto the ground. He was so close. He nearly had it. If it were not for Star-Lord—no, Peter did not have time to think about that because Mantis had been thrown away like she was nothing and he is pretty sure she is not conscious. He leaps to his feet and goes after her, wrapping her in his arms and activating the Iron Spider’s legs to help break their fall.

They land far away from the main fight and Peter can only watch the moment happen before him because the reality that maybe this is not the one outcome out of fourteen million that they win is hitting him so hard that he feels like he cannot breathe.

If he knew that this was going to be the end, he would have spent more time with Aunt May and Ned instead of going out at night, waiting for crime to happen. He would have visited you more at the X-Mansion, learned more about your time there, about your powers. Maybe he could have helped you out more, be it school or otherwise. He would have made more of an effort in school, maybe he would not have quit as many clubs as he did. Maybe he would have told MJ how he felt, maybe even hinted at it.

Peter thinks that he is too young to have so many regrets and he cannot bring himself to believe that this is the end of it all.

He is just about to gather his bearings, force himself to rejoin the fight, to help the adults out (oh my God, he really is just a kid compared to everyone here), when something crashes into the planet and sends everything and everyone flying. The gravitational pull of the planet seems to have been disturbed and Peter works fast to save his unconscious companions. He brings Mantis around with him, swinging around and avoiding debris, until he finds a place to web her to. He does the same for the others, quickly webbing them before the fly into orbit.

He regrets not knowing anyone’s names.

summary: Peter Parker x Reader | THE SPY| REQUEST
title: Peter Parker x Reader | THE SPY| REQUEST
body:
requested by @lotsoffandomimagines <3 ~

Me again! Thought that I might as well send in a Drabble request while I’m here. Can you a Drabble where you’re Nick Fury’s daughter who he enrolls into Peter Parker’s high school in order to keep an eye on him and Peter forming a crush on you not knowing that you’re spying on him. Thank you so much! - lotsoffandomimagines      

a.n. Once again, thank you Ace for the wonderful request. I hope I didn’t disappoint! Also I’m not sure how ‘school-ish’ this whole situation is…it’s been a few years… Also also it’s a tad short, but I’m tired and stressed so oh well.

“Why are you dropping me off, aren’t you supposed to be dead?” You scrowled at the ‘dead’ head of shield. The very alive Nick Fury - who was also your father - had employed the spying skills of his protege; you.

“Don’t gimme that sass, lots of people would be happy to see me.” You snorted.

“Yup, all of our enemies.”

As you pulled up to the school, Fury grabbed your arm and gave you his signature aggressively cool glare.

“You’re keeping an eye on him, not looking for trouble. Am I understood?” With a final roll of your eyes, you conceeded and nodded.

And thus, your mission began. Look out for Peter Parker. A bit of a boring job, you admitted, but it was far better than living in hiding for the next 2 years of your life.

Hiking your backpack up, you followed the lanky brunette into the school grounds. With the mass of students filling the building, it wasn’t long before you were almost pressed against his back in the rush. Not the ideal method of creating a lasting ‘friendship’.

“Peter! Peter!” A large kid pushed through the crowd toward you and his target. Ned, if you remembered your file correctly. Best friend, ever the nerd. Your train of thought dropped off as Parker whirled around, knocking your drink from your hand and causing you to stumble. He immediately caught the water before it hit the floor, stuttering out an apology. So you had the right guy.

“Oh, uh, I’m so sorry, so sorry.” He offered you his hand and effortlessly picked you up off the floor.

“No problem, all good!” You reassured him, giving your attempt at a shy, sweet smile. Your dad’s confident nature had certainly become a large part of your own personality and you struggled to keep a sassy reply in.

“I’m Peter, by the way. Peter Parker. And that’s Ned.” He awkwardly gestured to his friend, who gave a wave.

“Y/N, Y/N Wright.” Your alias slid off your tongue.

“Are you ever wrong?” You could see Peter mentally slapping himself as the joke left his mouth.

“Not normally, but that joke certainly was.” You laughed, reaching out to take the water bottle which was still in his hand.

“Oh yeah, of course. Water’s great. Love water.” He hastily pressed it into your hand.

“Because it led you to the most beautiful girl in the whole school? Are you seeing birds and wedding bells?” It was your turn to mentally slap yourself. Too much, Y/N.

Peter looked speechless for a moment.

“I’m messing with you.” You let out a giggle and shook your head. The bell rang and the two of you were shaken out of your conversation. “It was really great getting you meet you! See you soon!” You turned and made your way to your class. A smug grin made its way to your face - you had certainly made a good first impression.

That you had, as Parker remained where he was, gazing after you.

“She’s cool, huh?” Ned bumped his shoulder.

“Yeah…she’s really cool.”

summary: Sign me up for an all-female MCU group film! But, if the Avengers (2012) had Natasha Romanoff as the only woman on the team, I...
body: Sign me up for an all-female MCU group film! But, if the Avengers (2012) had Natasha Romanoff as the only woman on the team, I think there should be one guy in this team up too. After Endgame, that guy should be Peter Parker, especially after the scene where all the woman surrounded and protected him. All their dynamics with him would be incredible.

summary: Uh Parkner for the 30 otp question?
question: Uh Parkner for the 30 otp question?
answer:
Sure!!

Send me pairings and I will answer…

1)      who does the grocery shopping? Uuh, I would have to say both! 

2)      who gets to shower/bathe first after sexy time? Peter 

3)      who spends the most time naked? Uhh, Harley

4)      who tends to initiate sex? Depends, but mostly Harley? 

5)      who goes to sleep first? They probably go to sleep at the same time but Peter falls asleep first!

6)      who’s bigger in the downstairs department (metaphorically or physically)? Uuh Harley got some big dick energy.

7)      who gets up first in the mornings? Peter

8)      who says ‘I love you’ first? Harley, but it was probably just something that slipped out and Peter is like “aWW Ilyt” 

9)      who gets baby-crazy when they see children? Peter

10)   who steals the others clothes? P e t  e r

11)   who cooks better? I bet they both suck

12)   who leads when dancing? Harls

13)   who makes the puns/shitty references? They both do, at this point it’s like a competition who can make the shittiest ones.

14)   who stays up late, reading books whilst the other tries to sleep? Probs both of em, totally depends

15)   who pops the question? (and how?) Harley maybe, I’d like to think that they just do it very casually, like while eating breakfast or something aaaa

16)   who gets jealous when people flirt with their partner? Both, 

17)   who does the best pranks? They are both geniuses, so they both would be pretty good and extreme, but I also feel that Peter would be pretty good at acting so it all really depends on the prank.

18)   who drinks all the tea? Peter

19)   who is the most ticklish? Harley

20)   who is the loudest in bed? Peter 

21)   who has the most experience in relationships? Uhh Peter, I don’t think Harley dated a lot or at all before he met Peter

22)   who has the crazy ex? Probably Peter

23)   who handles their drink better? Harley 

24)   who feels they’re inadequate for their partner’s love? Probably both, but mostly Harley

25)   who gets passive aggressive during arguments? uuh Harley?? idk

26)   who has the most scars? Peter 

27)   who has nightmares? Both, poor kids give em a break pls ;; 

28)   who brings the stray puppy home and begs to keep it? Peter!! 

29)   who screams during horror movies? Peter

30)   who cries the most? Pete r 


Thank you for the ask!!

blog.name: spideystans
blog.description:
leila ✭ i like to write

“the sun will shine on us again”

title: — new recruits
body:
pairing: peter parker x reader

warnings: mild swearing, kissing, best friends to lovers

word count: 4,623 words

summary: you, a high school student with superpowers, are recruited by tony stark to join the avengers. your biggest worry is that you might bump into your best friend peter who’s doing the stark internship. there’s no way you could see him in the avengers tower, is there?

“Y/N, come out of your room for second,” your Dad calls and you groan in annoyance. “There’s someone here to see you!”

It’s probably Peter, you think as you force yourself to muster up enough strength to get out of your bed. You wince when your bruised hip brushes against your desk as you walk towards the door and immediately put on an impassive face to hide the fact that your entire body is aching.

Walking out the door, you smile at your dad and notice the person sitting next to him on the couch. When he turns around to wave at you, your jaw drops.

“Oh my God, you’re Tony Stark. The real Tony Stark, holy cow,” you blurt out, eyes wide. “Dad, that’s Tony Stark sitting next to you!”

“Yes, I am Tony Stark,” he says through a grin as though it’s obvious. Well, now that you think about it, it is obvious and you’ve just made a fool of yourself in front of Tony freaking Stark. “I’m here about the internship.”

“Internship?” you mumble, confused. “Like the actual Stark internship?”

“Hey, isn’t Peter doing that?” your dad pipes in.

“Uh, Peter Parker? A little awkward, talks a lot, loves making pop culture references?” asks Tony, shifting uncomfortably. “You know him?”

“Yeah, he’s my best friend,” you nod, a pit of guilt forming in your stomach at the mention of Peter. You’ve been neglecting him for weeks because you’re always too bruised up or tired to hang out recently. He probably feels the distance considering he hasn’t been asking to meet up either, you note. “You want me to do that internship?” you ask dubiously. You haven’t even signed up for it.

“We’ve been emailing each other about it, remember? I decided to take you up on it,” Tony smiles, glancing at your Dad quickly to see that he’s looking at you, perplexed. And then Tony winks at you frantically.

“Yeah,” you start off slowly, eyes narrowed. “The… the emails, yeah. I applied for the internship as well. I, uh, didn’t think I’d get it so I didn’t bother telling you, Dad. S-surprise?” you try for a casual chuckle.

To your shock, he just shrugs. “Well, I’m happy for you, it sounds good!” your dad nods encouragingly.

“If you don’t mind, would it be okay to speak to Y/N alone?” Tony politely asks, standing up from the couch.

“Sure, I’ll just be in the kitchen,” your Dad responds, shaking Tony Stark’s hand before making his way out.

Looking at Tony suspiciously, you say, “We’ll be in my room if you need us.”

Gesturing for him to follow you, the two of you walk towards your door and you swallow nervously about why he’s here. It’s a good thing you remembered to put concealer on your face today.

As you take a seat nervously on the edge of your bed, Tony shuts the door behind him. “So, you’ve probably guessed there’s no internship for you.”

“Oh? Really?” you feign ignorance. “That’s surprising considering the fact that I never applied.”

“About that,” he sighs, forming a temple with his fingers. “I’m just going to get straight to it. I know who you are.”

“I kind of assumed that when you said my name,” you roll your eyes to fake nonchalance when in actuality, your heart is pounding against your chest. He can’t mean what you think he means.

“Funny. You’re a funny one, you remind me of Peter,” he says, but you guess that he’s being sarcastic. “Does he know?”

“Know what?” you keep an impassive face, causing Tony to snort. “I don’t know what you’re talking about.”

A knowing smirk on his face, Tony pulls out his phone and types for a few seconds. Then, with a flick of his finger, he pulls up a recording of New York city at night.

Your palms become clammy when a lithe and slender figure comes into view, standing on the edge of a building. Dressed in all black, the figure jumps from the building and lands perfectly before an electronics store and walking in. You watch with bated breath as the video cuts to when a glowing light fills up the store and a couple of thieves walk out, empty handed.

“Oh, that’s the, uh, Supernova girl,” you swallow, squinting at the video. “Right?”

“Yeah, so how’d you do that?”

“Me?” you splutter, eyes wide. “That’s not me, I’m just a high school student!”

Rolling his eyes, Tony takes a seat next to you. “Does Peter know? Does your Dad even know?”

“No!” you shout, without thinking. Wincing at how you just gave yourself a way, you bury your face in your hands. “Neither of them can know anything. They’d be so worried, you don’t even understand. Everyone knows you’re Iron-Man. People at school would freak out!”

“I get that, you don’t have to tell them,” he nods, looking as though he wants to say something else. “Do you know Spider-Man, by any chance?”

“I know of him and I’ve seen him around,” you furrow your brows at the odd question. “But I work alone.”

“How do you work?” Tony asks, crossing his arms and looking curious. “Like, what makes people just listen to you and stop being criminals?”

“I don’t know,” you simply shrug, being truthful. “One day, I went out late at night to sit in the park and draw. Then I saw some weird, glowing piece of debris fell out of the sky and went to see. As soon as I touched it, I blacked out and woke up in my bed.”

“Hm,” Tony wrinkles his nose, dismissive. “Not the weirdest thing I’ve ever heard. So, what? You stare into people’s eyes and they just do what you want?”

“Yeah, and all my senses are heightened. It’s… really weird, but all I do is help little thefts and things around the neighbourhood. Nothing like Spider-Man and you with the Avengers,” you clarify hastily.

“Speaking of that, how would you feel about joining the Avengers?”

You blink.

“The what?” you mumble, not believing your ears. “You want me to join the Avengers?”

“Yes or no?” he states, looking expectant. “I won’t ask again.”

“Yes!” you exhale, heart racing. “Yes, of course, a thousand times yes!”

“That was a lot easier than he was,” Tony mutters, raising an eyebrow. You decide not to question who he’s talking about, still a little shaken. “Where’s your suit?”

“M-my suit? I just wear a black hoodie and leggings most of the time…” you trail off when you spot the horrified look on his face.

“You go around fighting criminals in a hoodie and leggings? You do realise you could get hurt in this job,” his demeanour becomes serious and almost parental as though he’s scolding you. “I guess I’ll have to send a suit then, be prepared to get one in the mail.”

Before you have any chance to speak or even thank him for making you a suit, Tony stands up and walks towards the door. “I’ll send you details via an actual email this time and we’ll see if you’re fit to be an Avenger, kid.”

Stomach churning- from excitement or nerves, you don’t know- you quickly stop him before he turns the handle. “You won’t tell my Dad, will you?”

“Of course not,” he assures you, but then adds as an afterthought, “unless you get seriously hurt. You gotta remember that I’m responsible for your life now and I can’t take any risks with that.”

“That’s fair, but… you won’t tell Peter either, right? I mean, he probably sees you guys whenever he goes there for the internship. I can’t let him know either.”

“Right,” Tony nods his head, awkwardly tapping his hands against the handle of your door. “The internship. Your secret is safe with me,” he mimes zipping his mouth and throwing away the key which causes you to let out a sigh of relief.

“Thanks, Mr Stark,” you offer him a smile as you open your door. “Now, let’s go and lie our asses off to my Dad.”

For someone who jumps off of buildings and faces numerous criminals who hold guns to your face, you really shouldn’t be this nervous.

They’re just the Avengers, you tell yourself. How intimidating can they possibly be?

Using the pass that Tony gave you, along with the protective suit he made, you make your way into the building known as the Avengers Tower.

As you pass into the elevator, you catch sight of your reflection. The new outfit feels foreign, but at the same time it feels like you. The all black theme of the figure-hugging suit makes you feel light and weightless- not as restrictive as your hoodie, but it’s paired with a thin hood that veils your hair, staying in place and a mask that covers the lower part of your face.

For dramatic purposes only, you decided to outline your eyes in a deep, black liner as soon as you got home from school, which is a huge contrast to your usually makeup free face. Admiring how different you look from your usual self, you almost don’t notice the elevator stop and the agent waiting outside.

“Hi, I’m Agent Hill,” the woman extends her hand to you with a polite smile as you step outside the elevator. “Tony has told me all about you, and the team are highly anticipating your arrival.”

She starts a brisk pace and you quickly run to catch up, stomach fluttering from anxiety. “A-all of them?” you say, but curse inwardly as soon as you realise you sound like a little kid. So much for showing you can be mature.

“Yeah, but don’t worry,” she laughs, waving it off. “You aren’t the only teenager, remember?”

Furrowing your brows, your silence causes Agent Hill to glance at you when you turn a corner. “Spider-Man,” she says as though the one name is an explanation. A shake of your head leads her to elaborate. “He’s the same age as you, didn’t you know?”

“Not really,” you laugh, nervously. You’re glad your face is mostly covered by your mask so that Hill can’t see your shock written plain as day all over your face. “I do know that Peter Parker is around here a lot because of the Stark Internship, do you know him by any chance?”

“I—You don’t… Uhm. Yeah,” she stumbles over her words, clearing her throat quickly. “Yes, I do know him.”

Her short and confusing response does nothing to calm you about the possibility that your identity may accidentally be revealed to your unknowing best friend. “Just a small favour… If Peter is ever here, he can’t know my real name.”

“Yep, understood,” her answer comes clipped and she starts walking faster. You soon reach a large door, which Agent Hill stops in front of. “Here we are. Ready?”

Taking in a deep breath, you nod, bracing yourself for this meeting. Agent Hill opens the door after muttering a couple words into her earpiece that you don’t quite catch.

As soon as the Avengers come into sight, you have to physically force yourself not to let out a scream.

“Hey, Supernova,” Tony smiles proudly when he sees the powerful effect his suit seems to have in making you look like an actual superhero. “Meet the Avengers.”

“Hi,” you mutter, barely audible as you wave an awkward hand in lieu of greeting. “I-I’m Y/N.”

“Steve Rogers,” says Captain America, stepping forward to shake your hand.

Holy crap, you just shook hands with Captain America. “Oh, I know all of your names already,” you clarify, bringing forth laughter from them all.

Sweeping a quick gaze across the room, you notice that apart from the original six Avengers, there’s Falcon, Bucky Barnes, Scarlet Witch and Vision. Most of them being preoccupied with their own business, you inch a little closer to Tony who’s the only person you know well.

Before you can think about who’s missing, Natasha cuts in. “Tony, isn’t she a little young? You want her to come on the latest mission?”

“I can take care of myself,” you quickly defend, not wanting to be labelled as a little kid on your first day of being here.

“We have no doubts about that,” Steve adds kindly. “But you have family and friends and school to think about too. You aren’t as expendable as some of us.”

“She’s actually the same age as—” Tony starts off but is interrupted by someone running into the room. “Speak of the devil.”

You notice that the person rushing down with his backpack on his bag is none other than the red and blue clad figure of Spider-Man.

“Sorry I’m late, I just got off school and had to stop some creep in an alleyway from annoying this woman, so I got a little held up and— woah, who’s this?” he comes at a stop in front of you.

His voice is so familiar that you don’t answer. Instead, you stare, dumbfounded at who’s voice you think you’re hearing. No… It can’t be.

Vaguely in the background you hear someone introduce you as Supernova, to which he responds with, “Oh, cool, they told me you’d be coming! I’m Spider-Man, nice to meet you.”

Taking off his mask, you find yourself face to face with none other than your best friend himself.

“P-peter?” you exhale, finding yourself paralysed.

He raises a brow, perplexed. “Yeah, that’s my name. Why do you sound so shocked?” he asks, chuckling.

Hands trembling, you lift your hands to your mask, hesitating for a second before removing it.

He stares for a second, smile fading.

“Y/N?” he whispers, his mask falling out of his grasp and onto the floor. “You’re Supernova? Wha— why the fuck didn’t you tell me?” he exclaims, incredulous.

“I— Why didn’t you tell me you’re Spider-Man?” you fire back, equally as irked.

“I asked first!”

“So, what—?”

“Do you two know each other?” Sam cuts you off, looking amused.

Glaring daggers into Peter once more before looking to Sam, you cross your arms. “Yes, he’s my supposed best friend.”

“Oh, that’s gotta be awkward,” Clint shakes his head in sympathy of your situation and the others hum in agreement.

“Supposed?” Peter scoffs and you stare him straight in the eyes. “What’s that supposed to mean?”

“It means that you’ve been lying to your best friend about the Stark Internship! Speaking of that,” you look at Tony to see he’s pretending to be preoccupied with some gadget. “Mr Stark, would you like to explain yourself now? Why didn’t you tell me you knew?”

“Woah, Tony knew?” Bruce pipes up, momentarily looking over from his table and raising his eyebrows, at the man in question. “This is on you, dude.”

“Hey, hey!” he raises his hands in surrender, wincing when he sees you and Peter looking expectantly for an answer. “In my defence, I knew you’d find out eventually and you did!”

“You weren’t exactly doing me a favour,” you scowl, blood boiling at the fact that he kept such a huge secret from you. Well, so did you, but that’s not the point.

Whipping around to look at you, Peter looks furious, but after knowing him for so long you can tell that he’s also little hurt. “We aren’t going to talk about this?”

“No, I’m a little pissed if you hadn’t noticed,” you reply, curtly and he laughs without a trace of humour at this.

“Oh, you think I’m happy that one of the people most important to me is risking her life every day and didn’t tell me?” Peter asks this with a disbelieving tone and your heart aches with a pang.

Okay, now you feel guilty.

“Don’t you realise you’re also important to me? And you’re constantly in greater danger, so how am I meant to live with that?”

Natasha lowers her voice and mumbles something to Steve, but you manage to make it out anyway. “I can’t tell if they’re arguing or making up.”

“Me neither,” he sighs, walking closer to you. “And unless you guys sort something out, neither of you are coming on this mission. I’m pairing you together.”

“Good,” Peter says with a serious expression at the same time that you exclaim otherwise.

“What?” you throw your hands up in frustration. “Do you know what that’s gonna be like? He literally acts like my mother half the time.”

“You did not just say that, Y/N, tell me you did not just say that,” Peter groans, covering his face with one hand in exasperation.

“Maybe if you weren’t so annoyingly protective when I’m perfectly capable of looking out for myself…” you trail off, shooting him a look.

Steve rolls his eyes at your back and forth argument and Tony just lets out a low whistle. When you catch Natasha’s eye, she has a little smirk playing on her face. She raises her eyebrows. Before you can inquire, Bruce walks over from his table of maps and papers along with the rest of the team.

“Alright, we have a plan and we just have to debrief you all on it now. The general idea is that we go in and disable the HYDRA weapon whilst also taking out any agents on the outside. I don’t know if we can even call them HYDRA, they’re just a bunch of psychos trying to keep the organisation going, but they’re dangerous nonetheless. Y/N, listen closely since this is your first time,” Bruce informs you and the excitement makes you hold in a smile.

“Let’s do this.”

“I TOLD YOU TO GO LEFT!” Peter screams through the earpiece when you land with a thump on your side next to a tree.

“I can’t go left when there’s someone with a gun trying to shoot at me from the same side,” you groan, lifting yourself up from the ground and immediately whipping around to stop a blow from an agent, locking his arm in your hold and staring him in the eyes. Straight away his own pupils begin to glow and his hold relaxes, posture straightening and you can now tell him what to do.

“Be a sweetheart and take down some of your own men, will you?” you smile and he nods in a trance, walking away with his gun.

“Good job, Y/N,” Steve says from inside the building, panting from exertion. “We’re almost done so try and stay low now.”

“You got it, Cap,” you respond, just as Peter lands next to you from goodness knows where.

Taking off his mask, Peter stares at you in amazement. “That was awesome! All you have to do is look at them? Do they even remember afterwards? Wait, have you ever tried to do that to me before?”

“Yes, no and no,” you list off the answers to his question, but then add with a teasing tone, “but who’s to say I won’t do it in the future? Watch out, Parker,” you whisper the last bit and Peter’s eyes widen as he stays silent.

Suddenly a voice sounds through the earpiece and makes you crack a smile. “Y/N, you’re scaring the kid,” Tony’s voice sounds vaguely preoccupied and you hear a few grunts and shots going off in the background.

“Mr Stark, do you need help?” Peter asks, worry lacing his voice and the two of you straighten up, ready to go and help.

“Nope, just finishing up.” A loud clang of metal resounds making you and Peter wince. “Getting ready to leave now.”

“Hey, web-slinger, can you grab Y/N and bring her to the ship?” Natasha yells over the sound of whirring machinery which makes you assume she’s already on board.

Putting his mask back on, Peter wraps a hand around your waist tightly and you cling on for dear life. Where his hands are placed, you feel heat searing through the material of your suit and it makes your cheeks warm up. Considering this isn’t the first time, you push the feeling down and swallow harshly. “Are you ready?” he asks, hand extended upwards.

“No, not really.”

“Great.” And then he shoots, lifting you off the ground to web his way to the ship. You keep your eyes shut the entire way, wind blowing around your hood. Within seconds you find yourself standing inside the ship as the exit closes slowly.

You lean on Peter for support as you get your bearings straight, swaying from slight dizziness. “Okay I never want to do that again.”

He just chuckles in response and the two of you walk into the main room where the others are gathered, most of them seated from the exhaustion of the mission.

“You guys are getting old,” Peter snickers into his fist as you and him seem to be the only ones who aren’t showing effects of running around in combat. “Also, web-slinger? Really?” he directs this at Natasha with raised eyebrows and an unimpressed air while she just smirks, shrugging.

“You did good, kid,” Tony nods at you, seeming to be satisfied with your work and pride blooms in your chest at his praise. You get the feeling he doesn’t offer it much. “Welcome to the Avengers.”

“Does this mean she gets to stay over whenever she wants?” Peter asks hopefully, but the question makes you fold your arms and furrow your brows.

“Hang on, is this why you’re never home anymore? You stay here all the time?” you scoff, shaking your head in irritation. The amount of times you decided to pay him a visit when you had a spare moment just to find out he wasn’t home is ridiculous, you think to yourself.

“Not all the time!” he’s quick to defend himself, raising his hands as though you’re pointing a gun at him. “I can’t just leave May by herself all the time, I’m only here some weekends! Plus, she knows.”

“You told Aunt May before me?” you narrow your eyes suspiciously and you can feel everyone’s eyes moving from you to Peter, back and forth as you talk. “Who else knows?”

“She found out by accident and so did Ned!” he rushes to explain, but upon realising what he just said, he stops and looks like a deer caught in the headlights.

Taken aback, you inhale once deeply. “Ned knows? And you didn’t tell me?”

“Have I fucked up?” Peter whispers frightfully to no one in particular as you glare at him with all the anger you can muster.

Before you can say that yes, he has fucked up, Natasha interrupts. “Careful, Steve doesn’t like that kind of language, remember?”

“Nat, I swear to God—”

“Language.”

Sweat drips down your forehead as you continuously fire punches in Peter’s direction, only to be met with air as he dodges them, turning up behind you to sweep you off your feet. Literally.

You grunt, twisting around to lie on your back for what feels like the hundredth time. This isn’t your first training session after you joined the Avengers and you definitely underestimated how hard it would be. From missions to sparring with Nat to surprise scenarios to test you it was physically draining, but you had to admit that you were starting to feel at home in the family like environment.

“You know, if this was a real fight, I’d just look at you and make you walk away,” you complain, taking his hand when he offers it to lift you off the ground.

He shrugs at this, giving you an apologetic smile. “Cap says you have to be prepared to fight without your powers, so it can’t be helped.”

“Yeah, well,” you roll your shoulders and stand in a fighting stance. You gotta say you’re getting tired of this. “Cap can’t control people with his eyes now, can he?”

Then, you lunge.

Peter catches your first fist in one hand, but stumbles when you kick into his side before grabbing hold of your leg and pulling you forward.

“Woah,” you gasp, falling into his chest with a force that knocks your breath away. That, combined with the fact his face is only inches from yours.

“I got you,” he whispers, lightly chuckling. With your leg wrapped around him and his hand on your thigh you can’t seem to think straight and you stutter, at a loss for words. When his eyes flicker down to your lips for a split second, your mind goes into overdrive and a bubble of nervous laughter escapes you.

“You know,” you whisper, eyes wide and stomach fluttering. “If this was in the middle of a fight, we’d be dead by now.”

“Good thing we’re alone then, huh?” Peter exhales and when his nose brushes against yours, you realise how little the space between you has become and how his lips are too far from yours for your liking.

“And that’s good because…?”

“Because it means I can kiss you,” he says and then immediately closes the distance that was separating you by pressing his lips against yours.

As his hand travels up your thigh to rest on your hip, the other cupping the side of your face as he kisses you, you fight back a shiver. Trailing a hand up his abdomen, you grip his shoulder as he deepens the kiss and you melt into his hold, humming contentedly.

You feel him smiling into the kiss before he breaks away to rest his forehead against your own.

“That wasn’t out of line, was it?” Peter asks a little breathlessly, looking up at you through his eyelashes. “I mean, you didn’t push me away, so that’s gotta count for something.”

“Well, I kissed you back, dumbass,” you respond, playfully rolling your eyes as you nudge his shoulder with your hand that rests there. “It kind of means that I like you.”

“Y-you do?” he repeats with wide eyes as if he’s a little unsure. You can also tell that underlying his expression of uncertainty is a smile that’s waiting to break through.

Grinning widely at this, you take his hand in your own and intertwine your fingers. “Yeah, I would have thought it was pretty obvious by now, but clearly you’re just as clueless! But…this isn’t going to be weird now, is it? We haven’t ruined our friendship now, have we?” your smile fades a little as you add this on, suddenly considering the situation. Your friendship with Peter is the most important thing you share and you’d never do anything to put it at risk.

“It isn’t weird unless you make it weird,” he reassures you, reciprocating your exuberance at the newfound confession that hangs between you. “And yeah, we have ruined our friendship, but that can be easily fixed.”

You tilt your head in questioning, furrowing your brows. “How’s that?”

“Be my girlfriend?” his voice comes out slightly doubtful, making it sound like a question as he sheepishly runs a hand through his hair.

“I guess you’re my boyfriend then,” you fight back a smile, but fail as soon as Peter’s eyes light up and he laughs with delight, leaning in to press another kiss against your lips.

Just as your eyes flutter shut and Peter’s hands thread into your hair, you hear a voice that makes you jump, startling you out of Peter’s hold.

“Clint, you owe me ten bucks!” you hear Natasha call out from somewhere outside the training room and your jaw drops, appalled that the Earth’s Mightiest Heroes bet on you.

“That’s– l don’t even know what to say,” you can’t help but shake your head and laugh at the sheer ridiculousness of the situation.

“Are you honestly surprised?”

“Nah, not really.”

summary: you, a high school student with superpowers, are recruited by tony stark to join the avengers. your biggest worry is that you might bump into your best friend peter who’s doing the stark internship. there’s no way you could see him in the avengers tower, is there?

“Y/N, come out of your room for second,” your Dad calls and you groan in annoyance. “There’s someone here to see you!”

It’s probably Peter, you think as you force yourself to muster up enough strength to get out of your bed. You wince when your bruised hip brushes against your desk as you walk towards the door and immediately put on an impassive face to hide the fact that your entire body is aching.

Walking out the door, you smile at your dad and notice the person sitting next to him on the couch. When he turns around to wave at you, your jaw drops.

“Oh my God, you’re Tony Stark. The real Tony Stark, holy cow,” you blurt out, eyes wide. “Dad, that’s Tony Stark sitting next to you!”

“Yes, I am Tony Stark,” he says through a grin as though it’s obvious. Well, now that you think about it, it is obvious and you’ve just made a fool of yourself in front of Tony freaking Stark. “I’m here about the internship.”

“Internship?” you mumble, confused. “Like the actual Stark internship?”

“Hey, isn’t Peter doing that?” your dad pipes in.

“Uh, Peter Parker? A little awkward, talks a lot, loves making pop culture references?” asks Tony, shifting uncomfortably. “You know him?”
